intro: Boerhavia acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved blite, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by small, round, dry fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in harsh environments. Boerhavia acutifolia is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
